meanings.definition: A plan proposed as an alternative to another plan.
meanings.sent1: The group came up with a counterplan to address the issue.
meanings.sent2: During the meeting, they discussed the counterplan to the original proposal.
meanings.sent3: The counterplan to have a picnic instead of a meeting was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent4: Her suggestion to go hiking was a clever counterplan to the usual movie night.
meanings.sent5: The counterplan to use public transport saved them money and reduced pollution.

meanings.definition: To propose a plan as an alternative to another plan.
meanings.sent1: She decided to counterplan by suggesting a different approach.
meanings.sent2: When faced with opposition, he chose to counterplan rather than give up.
meanings.sent3: The students counterplanned a surprise party for their teacher.
meanings.sent4: He counterplanned his route to avoid the heavy traffic.
meanings.sent5: In order to be more efficient, they counterplanned their work schedule for the week.
